content: आर्य {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [ऋ-ण्यत्] {@--1@} Āryan. {@--2@} Worthy of an Ārya. {@--3@} Worthy, venerable, respectable, honourable, noble, high; यदार्यमस्यामभिलाषि मे मनः <ls>Ś. 1. 22</ls>; so आर्यवेषः respectable dress; <ab>oft.</ab> used in theatrical language as an honorific adjective and a respectful mode of address; आर्यचाणक्यः, आर्या अरुंधती &c.; आर्य revered or honoured Sir; आर्ये revered or honoured lady. The following rules are laid down for the use of आर्य in addressing persons:-- (1) वाच्यौ नटीसूत्रधारावार्यनाम्ना परस्परं . (2) वयस्येत्युत्तमैर्वाच्यो मव्यैरार्येति चाग्रजः . (3) ( वक्तव्यो) अमात्य आर्येति घेतरैः . (4) स्वेच्छया नाममिविंप्रैविंप्र आर्येति चेतरैः . <ls>S. D. 431.</ls> {@--4@} Noble, fine, excellent. --र्यः {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of the Hindu and Iranian people, as distinguished from अनार्य, दस्यु and दासः विजानीह्यार्याव्ये च दरयवः <ls>Rv. 1. 51. 8.</ls> {@--2@} A man who is faithful to the religion and laws of his country; कर्तव्यमाचरन् कार्यमकर्तव्यमनाचरन् . तिष्ठति प्रकृताचारे स वा आर्य इति स्मृतः ... {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of the first three castes (as <ab>opp.</ab> to शूद्र). {@--4@} A respectable or honourable man, esteemed person; वृत्तेन हि भवत्यार्यो न धनेन न विद्यया <ls>Mb.</ls> {@--5@} A man of noble birth. {@--6@} A man of noble character. {@--7@} A master, owner. {@--8@} A preceptor. {@--9@} A friend. {@--10@} A Vaiśya. {@--11@} A father-in-law (as in आर्यपुंत्र). {@--12@} A Buddha. {@--13@} (With the Buddhists) A man who has thought on the four chief principles of Buddhism and lives according to them. {@--14@} A son of Manu Sāvarṇa. --र्या {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of Pārvatī. {@--2@} A mother-in-law. {@--3@} A respectable woman. {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of a metre, see Appendix.
